hook.text: After eight hours of video calls, she was more exhausted than after running a marathon. Zoom fatigue is real.

buildup.text: Video calls require hyper-focus on faces, constant self-monitoring, and reduced nonverbal feedback. The brain overworks.

discovery.text: Stanford research identified four causes: excessive close-up eye contact, self-view anxiety, reduced mobility, and cognitive load.

twist.text: Turning off self-view alone reduces fatigue by 15%. You don't watch yourself in real conversations â€” why do it digitally?

climax.text: Hide self-view, take audio-only calls when possible, and schedule five-minute breaks between virtual meetings.

punchline.text: Zoom fatigue is real. Hide self-view and take breaks.

quiz.question: What simple change reduces video call fatigue by 15%?
